review_title: (IME LEFT OVER) Abusive behaviour should not be allowed
pros: People here are generally nice other than cross overs from IME
cons:
The devil from IME is still larking around.
I totally understand the pain and frustration the Researchers are feeling. But what the Researchers or even the department heads of the Researchers do not know is that. The kind of abusive behaviour I had to endure with the “left overs” of IME. THAT Particular director left from IME now. He is abusive and tyrant, not to mention he takes all the credits for the work done by his staffs and presented as if he did all the work. When it comes to complaints, it’s everyone’s fault but his. He is a control freak or should I say he loves controlling and abusing his authority. He insults and demean his staffs when things are not done to his satisfaction or at random when he feels like it. He enjoyed it. This abuse has been going on for years now. 

There was one year, he sent separate emails to selected staffs and requested that we prepare and submit a full resume to him as if we were applying for a job. No he did not say for what purpose other than “as if we were applying for a job”. And he did not share anything after that. I will never forget that, because that was Christmas period where everyone was supposed to be enjoying their holidays but we (the affected ones) were left to worry if our jobs were at stake. That was during APA period. Is this HR protocol? Looking at your job history to determine your appraiser rating? I don’t think so

Now that telecommuting is a norm. There was one occasion when a staff accidentally activated the “record mode” of the Skype conference we were in. He quickly intercepted and demanded to know who is recording and said “you want to trap me”. Why would anyone say that? Well... it’s easy to figure right

I2r will be a better place without him. Anyway all Work are done by his direct reports. You don’t need him ASTAR. ASTAR should really look into a 360 degree feedback, to give people like me a glimpse of hope to undo the injustice.

I hate to admit it’s pathetic to resort to this platform to sound the injustice. Because there is no avenue within ASTAR for such matters.

review_title: May not have much career progression if you do not have a PhD
pros: Relax enviornment to work in. You are usually being viewed as a person above the industry average when you mention that you are from I2R.
cons: To many internal politics. There are too many power craving management level people around that make the research work very politically driven rather then for the real good of the company or Singapore.

review_title: Being a BMRC Post doc in Singapore
job_title: RSE2 Senior Research Fellow/Research Scientist I
pros:
Efficient system for hiring foreigners. 
Money.
Facilities.
cons:
If you think that a rich place makes you a great scientist, you are wrong. Singapore can in no way compare to Stanford, MIT harvard or EMBL. The scientific culture of melting pot of ideas and discussion is repressed by an obsession of the singaporean system about money spending and money earning. For great academics that you may be, we ask you to forget about key science which shaped you and gives us project which makes money in industry. The spirit of great well done science experiment is absent, it's all about pushing statistics of R&D index for Singapore(for attracting pharma industry) without much care of building and mentoring the spirit of discovery. 
Career advancement in BMRC is mainly reserved to Singaporean A*STAR scholar. Foreign post doc will always be slave to the system even with great performance from great papers, no opportunities for advancing to semi independent scheme is clearly transparent. Meritocracy is not in place and many favors are given to special people which is hided to the rest.
Basically don't expect to advance to group leader from a post doc perspective you will just be in transit for making a paper and that's it and since they scrape off that 6 year limit you can be post doc forever in the system which is not a solution for scientific career prospect 
Long delivery of chemicals and reagents(3 weeks to 3 months) is hard. It really limits you in your ability to solve problem in experiment in an efficient way.

review_title: Good place to start for fresh grads
pros:
- Good work life balance (i.e flexible working hours)
- Multicultural working culture
- Far-sighted senior management
cons:
- Little career progression and poor career training for those without PhDs
- No incentive to reward productive workers and little/no penalization for underperformers - usually average grade given during annual appraisal.
- Expected to multi-task all the time and be an expert in both Research and Development Projects. 
- Below average annual increment for existing staff
- Too many PRCs (converted/non-converted) in the workplace 
- Too much administrative overheads for simple processes

CEO is the major issue and A*STAR chairman driving this poor CEO....Goes probably all the way up to the Lee family and military officials pressure on semi-conductors industry (yep be ready to do military (public) contracts for a non democratic country...good for your soul)

Total waste of public money
